A careless admin leaked half their RSA private key. Your mission: decrypt 6471411214069970974224363483419336850295615438331987207860724824901952102025221784537496317893535686999808803586889978931996255818274608372860103703600951 using the partial information and recover the original message.

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8906600495199175066444261558726105884146662122505206947585883625480222415099547395011986721872802324778369296044483158230586579034215542140296651824100297, e=5061816799233038225641007570596488770360886592552470633996144979725822733906423328106504346556224300728410308485570390217125537000744488287497488602860235, partial_p=14927453621157177380

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{bs2hynwo}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 6471411214069970974224363483419336850295615438331987207860724824901952102025221784537496317893535686999808803586889978931996255818274608372860103703600951
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8906600495199175066444261558726105884146662122505206947585883625480222415099547395011986721872802324778369296044483158230586579034215542140296651824100297, e=5061816799233038225641007570596488770360886592552470633996144979725822733906423328106504346556224300728410308485570390217125537000744488287497488602860235, partial_p=14927453621157177380
extra_info: p=93701145030269910012597567370940238382709096257743123951054139711990011453203, q=95053272746260689279859468637628902737677276151883952208145405254403493384499, Ï†(n)=8906600495199175066444261558726105884146662122505206947585883625480222415099358640594210191273509867742360726903362771858176951958056342595330258319262596
